column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=DS : Is it healthy for us to be ringing these alarm bells every time one nuance in the argument gets addressed ?
#Text=NS :

#Text=There ’s a difference between predicting something is going to happen that might be an inaccurate prediction and making factual misstatements about what has already happened and what the law is .
#Text=There ’s a real difference .
#Text=So I think the analogy would only be apt if somebody said ,
#Text=“ The Supreme Court already has overturned Roe vs. Wade and brought back back-alley abortions . ”
#Text=That would be the counterpart to saying ,
#Text=“ The Supreme Court has removed religion from the public schools and the public sphere . ” I have not heard any pro-choice —
#Text=DS : But let ’s say the Christians give you that , and they say ,
#Text=“ This is just the first step and what they ultimately want is not to have the word God said anywhere in the public square . ”
#Text=NS :

#Text=But that ’s also counter-factual because if they looked at the ACLU ’s policy statements and they looked at our briefs , and they looked at our legislative testimony , they would see that we are constantly defending the rights of people to say God in the public square .
#Text=Every day we have cases where we are defending street preachers and people trying to baptize in the rivers …
#Text=DS : Whereas in the abortion argument it is a stated goal to bring about the end of Roe v. Wade .
#Text=NS :
#Text=Yes . Yes .

#Text=But it ’s interesting — I think as a responsible advocate you do have to read between the lines , not only what the Supreme Court says it is doing , but what it actually does , and here you not only have to rely upon those who agree with the result , but those who disagree with the result .

#Text=In the so-called Partial-Birth Abortion Ban Case , no less an anti-abortion proponent than Justice Scalia joined by Justice Thomas , in his separate opinion , chided the majority for not coming out and explicitly saying that they had overturned not Roe vs. Wade , but the prior partial-birth abortion ban case .

#Text=Remember there had been one six years before from Nebraska , and that ’s why every lower court to consider this said that based upon that precedent this law is indistinguishable , and that ’s why we are striking down this federal law .
#Text=The result here got a majority , but there were two separate opinions , one that was written by Kennedy and joined by the new justices ; and Scalia and Thomas supported the result .
#Text=But they had a separate opinion that said ,
#Text=“ You are not being honest , you have effectively overturned that earlier case , why do n’t you come out and say so ? ”
#Text=And the campaign finance reform case , same thing .

#Text=They said they were not overturning their earlier decision that upheld McCain-Feingold , and Scalia had a very quotable line where he was making the point he made with many earlier decisions , that he supported the result , but he was saying that they are not being honest about how far-reaching the result is .
#Text=This one was quoted a lot in the press ; he said ,
#Text=“ It is faux judicial restraint , which is really judicial obfuscation . ”
#Text=So as a responsible analyst and advocate , you have to look behind the lines .
#Text=Many are what we now know as landmark decisions , but they did n’t tell us they were landmark decisions , right ?
#Text=The old Commerce Clause cases .
#Text=But when the Supreme Court overturned the narrow view of the Commerce Clause in 1937 , it did n’t say it was making new law .
#Text=It paid lip service to the same old tests .
#Text=But lo-and-behold , it came out differently .
